intro: Papualthia tenuipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed rock cress, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often at high altitudes where conditions are harsh. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
